00022   struct RecList
00023   {
00024     virtual void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id) = 0;
00025     virtual int getSize() = 0;
00026 
00027     static std::string toLower (const std::string& name)
00028     {
00029         std::string lowerCase;
00030 
00031         std::transform (name.begin(), name.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00032             (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00033 
00034         return lowerCase;
00035     }
00036   };

00040   template <typename X>
00041   struct RecListT : RecList
00042   {
00043     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00044 
00045     MapType list;
00046 
00047     // Load one object of this type
00048     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00049     {
00050       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00051       list[id2].load(esm);
00052     }
00053 
00054     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00055     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00056     {
00057         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00058 
00059         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00060 
00061         if (iter == list.end())
00062             return NULL;
00063 
00064         return &iter->second;
00065     }
00066 
00067     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00068     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00069     {
00070         const X *object = search (id);
00071 
00072         if (!object)
00073             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00074 
00075         return object;
00076     }
00077 
00078     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00079   };

00168   /* Land textures are indexed by an integer number
00169    */
00170   struct LTexList : RecList
00171   {
00172     // TODO: For multiple ESM/ESP files we need one list per file.
00173     std::vector<LandTexture> ltex;
00174     int count;
00175 
00176     LTexList() : count(0)
00177     {
00178       // More than enough to hold Morrowind.esm.
00179       ltex.reserve(128);
00180     }
00181 
00182     int getSize() { return count; }
00183 
00184     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00185     {
00186       LandTexture lt;
00187       lt.load(esm);
00188       lt.id = id;
00189 
00190       // Make sure we have room for the structure
00191       if(lt.index + 1 > (int)ltex.size())
00192         ltex.resize(lt.index+1);
00193 
00194       // Store it
00195       ltex[lt.index] = lt;
00196     }
00197   };

00199   /* Landscapes are indexed by the X,Y coordinates of the exterior
00200      cell they belong to.
00201    */
00202   struct LandList : RecList
00203   {
00204     // Map containing all landscapes
00205     typedef std::map<int, Land*> LandsCol;
00206     typedef std::map<int, LandsCol> Lands;
00207     Lands lands;
00208 
00209     int count;
00210     LandList() : count(0) {}
00211     int getSize() { return count; }
00212 
00213     // Find land for the given coordinates. Return null if no data.
00214     const Land *search(int x, int y) const
00215     {
00216       Lands::const_iterator it = lands.find(x);
00217       if(it==lands.end())
00218         return NULL;
00219 
00220       LandsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find(y);
00221       if(it2 == it->second.end())
00222         return NULL;
00223 
00224       return it2->second;
00225     }
00226 
00227     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00228     {
00229       count++;
00230 
00231       // Create the structure and load it. This actually skips the
00232       // landscape data and remembers the file position for later.
00233       Land *land = new Land;
00234       land->load(esm);
00235 
00236       // Store the structure
00237       lands[land->X][land->Y] = land;
00238     }
00239   };

00241     struct ciLessBoost : std::binary_function<std::string, std::string, bool>
00242 {
00243     bool operator() (const std::string & s1, const std::string & s2) const {
00244                                                        //case insensitive version of is_less
00245         return lexicographical_compare(s1, s2, is_iless());
00246     }
00247 };

00250   // Cells aren't simply indexed by name. Exterior cells are treated
00251   // separately.
00252   // TODO: case handling (cell names are case-insensitive, but they are also showen to the
00253   // player, so we can't simply smash case.
00254   struct CellList : RecList
00255   {
00256     // Total cell count. Used for statistics.
00257     int count;
00258     CellList() : count(0) {}
00259     int getSize() { return count; }
00260 
00261     // List of interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00262     typedef std::map<std::string,Cell*, ciLessBoost> IntCells;
00263     IntCells intCells;
00264 
00265     // List of exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00266     typedef std::map<int, Cell*> ExtCellsCol;
00267     typedef std::map<int, ExtCellsCol> ExtCells;
00268     ExtCells extCells;
00269 
00270     ~CellList()
00271     {
00272       for (IntCells::iterator it = intCells.begin(); it!=intCells.end(); ++it)
00273         delete it->second;
00274 
00275       for (ExtCells::iterator it = extCells.begin(); it!=extCells.end(); ++it)
00276       {
00277         ExtCellsCol& col = it->second;
00278         for (ExtCellsCol::iterator it = col.begin(); it!=col.end(); ++it)
00279         {
00280           delete it->second;
00281         }
00282       }
00283     }
00284 
00285 
00286     const Cell* findInt(const std::string &id) const
00287     {
00288       IntCells::const_iterator it = intCells.find(id);
00289 
00290       if(it == intCells.end())
00291         return NULL;
00292 
00293       return it->second;
00294     }
00295 
00296     const Cell *searchExt (int x, int y) const
00297     {
00298         ExtCells::const_iterator it = extCells.find (x);
00299 
00300         if (it==extCells.end())
00301             return 0;
00302 
00303         ExtCellsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find (y);
00304 
00305         if (it2 == it->second.end())
00306             return 0;
00307 
00308         return it2->second;
00309     }
00310 
00311     const Cell *searchExtByName (const std::string& id) const
00312     {
00313         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00314         {
00315             const ExtCellsCol& column = iter->second;
00316             for (ExtCellsCol::const_iterator iter = column.begin(); iter!=column.end(); ++iter)
00317             {
00318                 if ( toLower(iter->second->name) == toLower(id))
00319                     return iter->second;
00320             }
00321         }
00322 
00323         return 0;
00324     }
00325 
00326     const Cell *searchExtByRegion (const std::string& id) const
00327     {
00328         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00329 
00330         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00331         {
00332             const ExtCellsCol& column = iter->second;
00333             for (ExtCellsCol::const_iterator iter = column.begin(); iter!=column.end(); ++iter)
00334             {
00335                 if (toLower (iter->second->region)==id)
00336                     return iter->second;
00337             }
00338         }
00339 
00340         return 0;
00341     }
00342 
00343     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00344     {
00345       count++;
00346 
00347       // All cells have a name record, even nameless exterior cells.
00348       Cell *cell = new Cell;
00349       cell->name = id;
00350 
00351       // The cell itself takes care of all the hairy details
00352       cell->load(esm);
00353 
00354       if(cell->data.flags & Cell::Interior)
00355         {
00356           // Store interior cell by name
00357           intCells[id] = cell;
00358         }
00359       else
00360         {
00361           // Store exterior cells by grid position
00362           extCells[cell->data.gridX][cell->data.gridY] = cell;
00363         }
00364     }
00365   };

00367   template <typename X>
00368   struct ScriptListT : RecList
00369   {
00370     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00371 
00372     MapType list;
00373 
00374     // Load one object of this type
00375     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00376     {
00377       X ref;
00378       ref.load (esm);
00379 
00380       std::string realId = toLower (ref.data.name.toString());
00381 
00382       std::swap (list[realId], ref);
00383     }
00384 
00385     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00386     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00387     {
00388         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00389 
00390         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00391 
00392         if (iter == list.end())
00393             return NULL;
00394 
00395         return &iter->second;
00396     }
00397 
00398     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00399     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00400     {
00401         const X *object = search (id);
00402 
00403         if (!object)
00404             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00405 
00406         return object;
00407     }
00408 
00409     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00410   };

00412   template <typename X>
00413   struct IndexListT
00414   {
00415         typedef std::map<int, X> MapType;
00416 
00417         MapType list;
00418 
00419         void load(ESMReader &esm)
00420         {
00421             X ref;
00422             ref.load (esm);
00423             int index = ref.index;
00424             list[index] = ref;
00425         }
00426 
00427         int getSize()
00428         {
00429             return list.size();
00430         }
00431 
00432         // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00433         const X* search (int id) const
00434         {
00435             typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id);
00436 
00437             if (iter == list.end())
00438                 return NULL;
00439 
00440             return &iter->second;
00441         }
00442 
00443         // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00444         const X* find (int id) const
00445         {
00446             const X *object = search (id);
00447 
00448             if (!object)
00449             {
00450                 std::ostringstream error;
00451                 error << "object " << id << " not found";
00452                 throw std::runtime_error (error.str());
00453             }
00454 
00455             return object;
00456         }
00457   };
